There is no charge for the above services with the Japan Rail Pass.
The best way to get around Sabae is by car, though there is a local train that goes through the city.

value: - This small park is particularly beautiful in springtime, when hundreds of azaleas trees bloom on the slopes. There is also a small zoo there, complete with red pandas.

- Sabae is the center of the Japanese eyeglass industry. 90% of frames are made here. There are many great shops around the city to get your own locally made pair.
Rt. 8, a major road linking Fukui prefecture with Kanazawa, runs through Sabae, so you can find many local and national chain restaurants along the road.

value: - While most of Japan prefers to eat its katsudon (breaded pork cutlet on top of rice) topped with a sweet omelet, Fukui prefecture is famous for creating the sauce katsudon, which is instead covered by a sweet and salty sauce similar to Worcester sauce.  It is ubiquitous on menus in Sabae.
- Cold buckwheat noodles with grated Japanese radish.
(Konomi) - a great little okonomiyaki restaurant near Nishiyama Park.　2-8-19 Sakuramachi, Sabae. +81 778-52-0806 ‎
